summary: The 'Safeguarding the Transparency and Efficiency of Payments Act' (STEP Act) aims to improve the prevention of improper payments by amending Title 31 of the United States Code. It redefines 'chief financial officer,' modifies reporting requirements for improper payments, including new programs and activities, and mandates annual reports on agencies' progress in implementing financial controls and fraud risk management. The bill does not authorize additional funding for these purposes.
